drug.name: Ferric oxide
drug.description: Iron(III) oxide or ferric oxide is the inorganic compound with the formula Fe2O3. It is one of the three main oxides of iron, the other two being iron(II) oxide (FeO) the rarer form, and iron(II,III) oxide (Fe3O4) which naturally as magnetite.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as transition metal oxides. These are inorganic compounds containing an oxygen atom of an oxidation state of -2, in which the heaviest atom bonded to the oxygen is a transition metal.

drug-interaction.name: Dimercaprol
drug-interaction.description: Dimercaprol may increase the nephrotoxic activities of Ferric oxide.

drug-interaction.name: Cefdinir
drug-interaction.description: Ferric oxide can cause a decrease in the absorption of Cefdinir resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

drug-interaction.name: Deferiprone
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Deferiprone can be decreased when it is combined with Ferric oxide.
